summary: Web app with authentication; user requests to remove an image from the UI and change post-login routing to go directly to the dashboard. Current issue: application fails to load with a generic unexpected error.
known_issues: Application fails to load with error: "Something went wrong â€” An unexpected error occurred while loading the application."

existing_features.title: Identify and fix the client-side runtime error that causes the app to render the router error fallback screen ("Something went wrong") on initial load, so authenticated users can reliably see the app (Dashboard and other routes) without crashing.

Remove the LivSpan logo image from the UI so no image is displayed on the login screen and in the authenticated header area (e.g., remove/disable the rendering that references "/assets/MagicEraser_251230_145221.png"), while keeping the rest of the layout visually coherent.
After a user completes authentication (Internet Identity login), always route them directly to the Dashboard route ("/") regardless of which route they attempted to visit while unauthenticated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Do not display the image/banner (remove the image from the UI)
After login, redirect users directly to the dashboard (update post-auth routing)

projectName: Remove logo image, redirect to Dashboard after login, and fix app load crash
